The cost of education certainly has skyrocketed    Taking money away from universities will not make education less expensive. If your goal is to burn US higher education to the ground, leaving behind only hollowed-out shells of the most prestigious universities to educate the  children of the wealthiest elite, then taxing universities is a great way to go about it. Otherwise, taxing universities a terrible idea.   In addition to bleeding endowments dry, stripping universities and colleges of tax-exempt status will drive away donors. No one is going to give money when (a) it doesn't qualify as a charitable donation and (b) some of it will go to the government instead of the institution the donor is attempting to support. Among other things, the resulting financial downspiral will drive top researchers out of the US and lock out promising grad students/early career researchers from other countries.
